title: Can we buy money with money? - Quora

response.answer_text: Banks do this all the time. They will buy a form a currency in the hopes (or educated guesses) that the currency will rise in value and then sell the money to someone else at a profit (or sometimes a loss). You cant say buy a US dollar a US dollar, you’d buy something like a euro or another form of currency. If the exchange rate of the currency increases in favor of the currency you bought, you could then convert it back into the original form for a profit. For example if I went into canada, or a bank that is able to exchange my US dollars into canadian dollars, then waited for the exchange rate of the canadian dollar to improve, i could then go back to the bank and exchange the canadian dollar back into US dollars for a profit. its a lot like playing the stock market in a way

A proverb “Money brings Money”Huge invest hoge profit. Huge factoray huge Product.Huge product huge money.If you have $1 Dollar , you can increase it $1 to 1.5 Dollar,not i million or billion,But If you have $1 Billion Dollar you can increase it 1 billion to 1.5 billion.Every goverment buy money or exchange money with others. So money buy money.
No!!! If you are just receiving equal money it is an exchange, if the value increases it is an investment, if it is equal and you receive something other than money it is a purchase.
IT SURE CAN……BUT IT WILL COST YOU.
“Money has never made man happy, nor will it; there is nothing in its nature to produce happiness. The more of it one has the more one wants.”­ – Benjamin Franklin

Of course, money has a snowballing effect, compound interest, so that once you break through the threshold where your investment income exceeds your income then wealth grows exponentially, so money is buying money
